elements.title: BetMakers Technology Group Ltd Directors' Report 30 June 2022

data.value: The consequences of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic are ongoing, and its impact on the Group, if any, has been reflected in its published results to date. It is not possible at this time to state that the pandemic will not subsequently impact the Group's operations going forward. The Group now has experience in the swift implementation of business continuation processes, and these processes continue to evolve to minimise any operational disruption. Management continues to monitor the situation both locally and internationally.
Nicholas Chan, Chairman and Non-Executive Director; Todd Buckingham, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer.

Nicholas (Nick) Chan has more than 30 years’ experience in media and has held senior leadership and operational roles with leading Australian media companies. Most recently Group Chief Operating Officer at Seven West Media.

Todd Buckingham has more than 20 years’ experience working in the Sports and Wagering industry in Australia. After completing a double bachelor’s degree in 2000, Todd taught for 5 years at Hunter Sports High School while working as a sports manager.
Non-Executive Director. Experience: Over 25 years in media, former Fairfax Media executive. Operates a private consultancy.
Non-Executive Director – appointed 8 February 2022. Experience: 20 years as legal practitioner, principal director of boutique legal firm.
Non-Executive Director – appointed 3 March 2022. Experience: Independent Non-Executive Director on several boards, background in finance.
Member, Audit & Risk Committee; Member, Nomination & Remuneration Committee.
Matt Davey has a deep knowledge of the US gaming and wagering market. Former CEO of NYX Gaming Group.
Executive Director, Tekkorp Digital Acquisition Corp (NASDAQ: TEKK)

Bookmaking and betting industry experience, Information technology, Business acquisition and integration skills, Financial literacy, Legal and regulatory knowledge, Diversity, Policy and regulatory development, Health and safety, Organisational development

data.key: Employee benefits obligation expected to be settled after 12 months

data.value: The table shows employee benefits obligations that are expected to be settled after 12 months. There is a significant increase from 774 in 2021 to 1,208 in 2022, representing approximately a 56% rise in long-term employee benefit obligations.

data.key: Non-current liabilities Deferred consideration Lease make good

data.value: The table shows non-current liabilities comparison between 2022 and 2021, with values in thousands of dollars. It includes deferred consideration and lease make good provisions. There is a general decrease in liabilities from 2021 to 2022, with total figures dropping from approximately $9.1M in 2021 to $8.4M in 2022. The deferred consideration decreased from $8,750K to $7,500K, while lease make good provisions increased slightly from $76K to $115K.

Executed agreement to be the exclusive technology provider to the NTD consortium, with potential revenues in excess of $300m over 10 years. Launched 12 additional platforms in the Australian market. Executed a further 8 platform agreements across Australia, US, and Canada which are due to launch this year. Executed an amended agreement with the New Jersey Thoroughbred Horsemen Association extending the term for BetMakers to exclusively manage fixed odds betting on thoroughbred horse racing in New Jersey. Expanded North American content to more than 12,000 races annually. Executed a binding Heads of Agreement to become the exclusive provider of pari-mutuel betting racing services to Caesars Entertainment Inc. brick-and-mortar retail sportsbook locations in Nevada. Selected as the new tote and technology and services provider for Norway under a 10-year agreement. Extended Parimutuel services agreement with Monmouth Park for a further 5 years.
The outlook for FY23 looks exciting with a focus on executing the Company strategy and realizing growth opportunities. Benefits from signed deals in FY22 anticipated to flow throughout FY23.
Persons having authority and responsibility for planning, directing and controlling the major activities of the Group, directly or indirectly.

elements.title: BetMakers Technology Group Ltd - Notes to the Financial Statements

data.value: Revenue is recognised when services are rendered. GBS includes racing data, analytical tools, and betting products. Revenue derived is either a fixed fee or a percentage of turnover/profit.
Revenue is recognised when services are rendered. Global Tote includes tote software and integrations for liquidity. Revenue is derived as a fixed fee or percentage of turnover.
Interest revenue is recognised as it accrues, using the effective interest method.
Assets and liabilities are classified based on expected realisation/settlement within operating cycle or 12 months.
A provision is made for restoration costs of leased premises based on future estimates.
Revenue and expenses are recognised net of GST unless not recoverable. Receivables/payables include GST amounts.
Amounts in this report have been rounded off in accordance with Corporations Instrument 2016/191.
Recently issued or amended but not yet mandatory accounting standards have not been early adopted.
Amends AASB 101 for classification of liabilities as current or non-current.
Judgement regarding impacts on products, services, customers, supply chain, staffing.
Measurement based on fair value at the grant date using models.
Assessment based on lifetime expected credit loss and judgement.

Increase in life expectancy results in increased liabilities.
The group operates internationally and is exposed to foreign exchange risk arising from various currency exposures.
The group had net assets denominated in foreign currencies of $494,000.
Had the Australian dollars weakened by 5% against foreign currencies, profit before tax would have been $24,700 lower.
The actual foreign exchange loss for the year ended 30 June 2022 was $1,998,000.

elements.title: BetMakers Technology Group Ltd Directors' report 30 June 2022

data.key: Significant Changes in the State of Affairs
data.value: On 16 July 2021, the Group issued 34,564,921 shares to Waterhouse VC Pty Ltd and recorded relevant revenues of $6,221,685.70. On 31 January 2022, the Group issued an additional 45,862,414 shares to Waterhouse VC Pty Ltd with relevant revenues of $8,255,234.50.
There were no dividends paid, recommended or declared during the current or previous financial year.
The group announced the intention to undertake an on-market share buy-back on 24 June 2022, which commenced on 12 July 2022.
Sufficient revenues were generated for the conversion of Class C Performance Rights into options to purchase shares.
